newly rebuilt hopeful market in hanover
opens
more than 24 vendors will be occupying
the newly rebuilt opel market in hanover
which was officially opened on thursday
by a minister of local government and
world development desmond mckenzie the
modern facility constructed at a cost of
approximately 23 million dollars
replaces the old market that had fallen
into disrepair
the rebuilt structure boasts new stalls
fish and meat areas storage bathrooms
and other amenities to enhance the
experience of vendors and buyers it will
serve a population of some six thousand
people who live in and around the
township
in its address mckenzie said the
government recognizes the importance of
markets as the center of commerce in
rural towns and as such has been
rehabilitating facilities across the
island since 2016 the government led by
prime minister andrew holness has spent
quite a lot on markets across the
country said mackenzie we built a brand
new market in port maria at a cost of 60
million dollars we built a brand new
market in falmouth in trelawney this
market in hopewell was not renovated but
instead we built an entirely new market
for the vendors and the residents he
noted the local government minister said
work on the hopeful market was completed
within budget and took into
consideration the recommendations
offenders who were engaged part two and
during the construction he urged vendors
that in addition to protecting the
infrastructure they should also ensure
that they pay their market fees
understand that the market fees are what
they use to maintain the place more
people will be employed no so you have
bathrooms you need attendance you have a
new facility you need to have security
the place needs to be kept clean so it
means new persons have to be employed
mckenzie pointed out
he noted that the government since 2016

hanover
we made a commitment to deliver and that

and keep it clean
i think we'll have more customers

a distinguished an exemplary campaign pm
laws johnson smith following secretary
general defeat
prime minister andrew holmes today
commended minister of foreign affairs
and foreign trade committee johnson
smith for what he called a distinguished
and exemplary campaign for commonwealth
secretary general
johnson smith was defeated by the
incumbent baroness patricia scotland at
the commonwealth heads of government
meeting in rwanda today
scotland received 27 votes to johnson
smith's 24.
jamaica remains deeply proud of minister
johnson smith and we're happy to have
put forward such a strong credible and
competent candidate holden said in a
statement
her candidacy won of the respect and
admiration of many countries within our
commonwealth family and brought
prominence to jamaica and her ability to
contest within such a large
international institution wholeness
continued the prime minister extended
congratulations to scotland and express
jamaica's support for the commonwealth
jamaica continues to believe in the
commonwealth its diversity and its
potential to deliver for its people
jamaica reports 150 new coveted cases
five debts
jamaica reported 150 new cases of covet
19 and five fatalities on thursday
according to the latest statistics on
the ministry of health and wellness this
pushed the total number of cases of the
virus since the start of the pandemic to
161 and the death toll to 3
of the newly reported cases there were
94 females and 56 males with ages
ranging from 9 months to 85 years
the cases were recorded in kingston and
saint catherine 35 sent on 22 sent to
james 13 clarendon 10 manchester eight
centum seven trelloni 6 saint elizabeth
5 hanover 4 and westmoreland 2.
meanwhile the latest fatalities are an
81 year old man from saint catherine
whose death was recorded in june 2021
a 75 year old man from saint anne whose
death was recorded in june 2021 a
90-year-old man from saint anne whose
death was recorded in june 2021 a 7 year
old woman from saint anne whose death
was recorded in june 2021 and a 54 year
old man from clarendon whose death was
previously recorded under investigation
in july 2021
two more deaths reported on the
investigation and another was reported
as coincidental
the country also recorded 85 new
recoveries bringing the total number of
recoveries to 90
387. the positivity rate for the latest
round of testing was 21
there are 114 people hospitalized three
of them critically ill there are
1713 confirmed active cases on the
